choices.B: Log backups from the CLI cannot be restored to another FortiGate.

questions.question_text: When browsing to an internal web server using a web-mode SSL VPN bookmark, which IP address is used as the source of the HTTP request?

choices.C: The remote user's public IP address
choices.D: The internal IP address of the FortiGate device
choices.B: The public IP address of the FortiGate device
choices.A: The remote user's virtual IP address

discussion.content: Correct Answer is D, FortiGte_Security_6.2study_Guide_Online Page 576
Infrastructure study guide 6.4 p576 "User's source IP is replaced by Fortigate's internal IP address"
D is correct. "User's source IP address is replaced by Fortigate's IP address" - Security guide.
D is Correct - Security_Manual, p.578

The connection is public for sslvpn suppose, you navigate to an internal server (external connection).
The correct one for me is B
Answer is B

comments.content: nvm. The question asks next step after sslvpn connection. Answer is D.

choices.D: The interface has been configured for one-arm sniffer.
choices.C: The interface is a member of a zone.
choices.E: Captive portal is enabled in the interface.
choices.B: The interface is a member of a virtual wire pair.

questions.question_text:
An administrator observes that the port1 inteface cannot be configured with an IP address.
What are three possible reasons for this? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: FGT-Infra-6.2,p173 (virtual wire pair)
FGT-Security-6.2, p.34 (one-arm sniffer)
A, B & D are correct - FGT-Security-6.2, p.17, p.174-175, https://www.infosecmonkey.com/2019/03/21/fortigate-in-one-arm-sniffer-mode/
